[TITLE]
<line: 11> UNITED STATES JUDICIAL PANEL

<line: 13> MULTIDISTRICT LITIGATIONS

[TITLE]
<line: 15> IN RE: ZIMMER NEXGEN KNEE IMPLANT
<line: 16> PRODUCTS LIABILITY LITIGATION

[ABANDON]
<line: 18> MDL No. 2272

[TEXT]
<line: 20> (SEE ATTACHED SCHEDULE)

[TITLE]
<line: 22> CONDITIONAL TRANSFER ORDER (CTO -367)

[TEXT]
<line: 24> On August 8, 2011, the Panel transferred 18 civil action(s) to the United States District Court for the
<line: 25> Northern District of Illinois for coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings pursuant to 28
<line: 26> U.S.C. $ 1407. See 802 F.Supp.2d 1374 (J.P.M.L. 2011). Since that time, 1,609 additional action(s)
<line: 27> have been transferred to the Northern District of Illinois. With the consent of that court, all such
<line: 28> actions have been assigned to the Honorable Rebecca R. Pallmeyer..

[TEXT]
<line: 30> It appears that the action(s) on this conditional transfer order involve questions of fact that are
<line: 31> common to the actions previously transferred to the Northern District of Illinois and assigned to
<line: 32> Judge Pallmeyer.

[TEXT]
<line: 34> Pursuant to Rule 7.1 of the Rules of Procedure of the United States Judicial Panel on Multidistrict
<line: 35> Litigation, the action(s) on the attached schedule are transferred under 28 U.S.C. s 1407 to the
<line: 36> Northern District of lllinois for the reasons stated in the order of August 8, 2011, and, with the
<line: 37> consent of that court, assigned to the Honorable Rebecca R. Pallmeyer.

[TEXT]
<line: 39> This order does not become effective until it is filed in the Office of the Clerk of the United States
<line: 40> District Court for the Northern District of Illinois. The transmittal of this order to said Clerk shall be
<line: 41> stayed 7 days from the entry thereof. If any party files a notice of opposition with the Clerk of the
<line: 42> Panel within this 7-day period, the stay will be continued until further order of the Panel.

[ABANDON]
<line: 44> Inasmuch as no objection is
<line: 45> ending at this time,the
<line: 46> Stay is lifted..
<line: 47> Nov 16, 2016
<line: 48> ILTIDISTRICT LITIGATION

[FIGURE]
<line: 50> FOR THE PANEL:

<line: 52> Jeffery N. Luthi

<line: 55> DEPUTY CLERK

<line: 57> DISTRICT OF ILLINOIS
<line: 58> November 16, 2016
